subject: Self Care
title: The Weakness Myth
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Weakness Myth.

hook.text: Real strength is being harsh with myself. That's what he believed for 30 years. It cost him two marriages.

buildup.text: Many cultures equate toughness with self-criticism and gentleness with weakness. The research says the opposite.

discovery.text: Self-compassionate people show more emotional resilience, coping ability, and courage than self-critical ones.

twist.text: It takes more courage to be kind to yourself than to attack yourself. Criticism is the easy default. Kindness is the brave choice.

climax.text: Reframe self-compassion as fierce, not soft. A warrior who cares for their own wounds fights better the next day.

punchline.text: Self-compassion is courage, not weakness. Rewrite the script.

quiz.question: What does research show about self-compassion and strength?
options: Self-compassionate people show more resilience and courage
There's no connection between compassion and strength
